vulnerability_findings.name: array-length-outside-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: Caching the array length outside a loop saves reading it on each iteration, as long as the array's length is not changed during the loop.

vulnerability_findings.name: unnecessary-checked-arithmetic-in-loop
vulnerability_findings.message: A lot of times there is no risk that the loop counter can overflow. Using Solidity's unchecked block saves the overflow checks.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-prefix-increment-not-postfix
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using the prefix increment expression whenever the return value is not needed. The prefix increment expression is cheaper in terms of gas.

vulnerability_findings.name: calls-loop
vulnerability_findings.message:
Multicall.aggregate has external calls inside a loop:
	- (success,ret) = calls[i].target.call(calls[i].callData) (Multicall.sol#20)

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in Multicall.sol:
	- Version used: ['>=0.5.0', 'ABIEncoderV2']
	- Multicall.sol#3 declares pragma solidity>=0.5.0
	- Multicall.sol#4 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-short-revert-string
vulnerability_findings.message: Shortening revert strings to fit in 32 bytes will decrease gas costs for deployment and  gas costs when the revert condition has been met.

vulnerability_findings.name: incorrect-use-of-blockhash
vulnerability_findings.message: blockhash(block.number) and blockhash(block.number + N) always returns 0.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-nested-if
vulnerability_findings.message: Using nested is cheaper than using && multiple check combinations. There are more advantages, such as easier to read code and better coverage reports.
